data.title: Love Coffee
data.text: Great Customer Service! Very Friendly Staff, fast service didnt had a long wait in line. I love Starbucks

data.title: good service!
data.text: I had pleasant experience on a busy Monday morning in New York City - friendly barrista took my order smiling and spelled my name correctly!

data.title: love coffee
data.text: it is a good place where you can take your laptop and work hours. Not all starbuck has good enough place to sit but this one does

data.title: Loved It
data.text: This place is the bomb. It's nice and clean. The staff was nice and quick with orders. If you like Starbucks this is defiantly one you will like.

data.title: good coffe
data.text: Not the nicest Starbucks. A little shabby and worn out, like many others in big cities. But the coffee is fine.

data.title: Toilets a disgrace
data.text: Told by a staff member they dont have toilet paper. Told me to gk to Dunkin Donuts rest room. So im supposed to go the toilet here and go wipe myself at a competitor. Not a third world country. Toilets unhygienic they stink looks like bin has not been emptied in days. Feel ashamed for you starbucks. Your staff here clearly dont care about basic human rights

data.title: Mac do of the coffe shop
data.text: Getting your coffee at a Starbucks is like going to have meat at Mc Donald there so many great small coffee shop in NY where the first thing they ask is do you want a small medium or large !

data.title: Standard starbucks!
data.text: As usual, the coffee was as expected. It was crowded. If you're looking to grab quick coffee without any need to sit down and chat, this is the place. I would suggest trying other place if you want to have a better sit down experience.

data.title: Often busy, but good customer service
data.text: This Starbucks is often very full, sometime with no seating. However, the customer service of the staff is good.

data.title: The buck does not stop here
data.text:
The service from the Baristas is good.   The big problem with this particular Starbucks is it that it is not really a place where you can unwind and relax.  

It is in the City Hall area.  Place is mad, crazy, busy and you probably will not be able to get a seat.  If you want to get your drink to go you could always, assuming the weather is good, sit in City Hall Park.

Also, because this store attracts a lot of tourists the line for the bathroom is unreal.  Estimated wait many days -- 15+ minutes.

All Starbucks have a policy of making your drink to your satisfaction so as far as taste goes you will not be disappointed.

Since Starbucks is a chain you probably wouldn't find anything exotic on its shelves or the "dairy" case.  They do have an $8 lunch special = 3 items: appetizer, sandwich and bottled water ( a good deal by NYC standards).

Keep your eyes out though for the specials.  They can be really good, e.g., the $5 Pumpkin Spice Latte for $3.00.

data.title: Average Coffee But Then Again It is Starbucks
data.text: The coffee is typical of Starbucks. As this location is near a tourist location (World Trace Center), it is crowded. So expect a long wait to make an order and an even longer one to receive your order. It was also dirty due to the high traffic.

data.title: Nothing beats coffee and a smile
data.text: I visit several Starbucks stores that are my favorites.  The staff here are very pleasant and make every effort to know your name and what you like once you become a regular.

data.title: Close to Brooklyn Bridge and there is a bathroom
data.text:
This Starbucks is close to City Hall and right by the entrance to the walking path to the  Brooklyn Bridge.  I used to live close to here, always a convenient spot for coffee and if needed, there is a customer friendly bathroom here.  Now remember folks, Starbucks is known for their pumpkin spice lattes, not bathroom service, so go easy on the nice people there.  

Service can be slow, but the place is always crowded, so it is expected.

data.title: Upscale Starbucks with inexperience people
data.text:
After visiting the Met Museum we went here for our drinks. Ordered and paid and thereafter, waited and waited and waited some more. Finally our drinks were done, but they were all wrong. They made them again and finally we received the proper drinks.
This place needs a good manager to tell people what to do. Service lacks and drinks are off.

data.title: Coffee of the morning
data.text: I always come thru here with my starbucks coffee and sit here.  I bring out my cell phone and always find a new destination to visit on Tripadvisor

data.title: Pretty much sucks...
data.text: This is not a review of this particular location, but the chain in general.  Starbucks is a coffeeplace with (in my opinion) bad coffee, but some locations have a nice atmosphere.  So it could be nice to sit and...drink anything but the coffee.  Try the stuff that has a lot of other ingredients that will hide the coffe taste.  The one good thing I like about Starbucks is the range of mugs they offer.

data.title: New York holiday
data.text: Went to starbucks today for lunch. Food and drinks were fine but the line up for the bathroom was 10 people deep. Stood in line for a good half an hour. There were 2 bathrooms but one is apparently used only for employees. The bathroom for the paying customers  ( who had to wait in line for ages) was fu#÷g disgusting. The greedy bastards are happy to take your money but not provide clean  conveniences for there customers. I complained about having to wait so long for the bathroom considering there were actually 2 bathrooms only to be told the the employee bathroom has chemicals stored in it. What a joke. Don't  go anywhere near this place if you think you need to go to the bathroom.

data.title: Great location, great coffee
data.text: As a natuve NY'er when I find an out of the way but easy to find Starbucks, I am always happy. The atmosphere was great and the coffee break phenomenal

data.title: On the go
data.text: clean, friendly staff and the restrooms are good.  I would recommend this place if you are on a short travel and in need of good coffee

data.title: It's just Starbucks.......aka Fourbucks
data.text: The are sooooo many unique coffee cafe's in NYC......why go here. Google coffee shops in your area and see what pops up.
